newsitem.title: USA: BEFORE THE BELL - Intel firms on EPS news.
newsitem.headline: BEFORE THE BELL - Intel firms on EPS news.

text.p: Intel Corp's powerful fourth quarter earnings report extended the stock's two-week ascent in Wednesday pre-open trade, lifting the shares 1-7/8 to 149, 3/4 short of Intel's year-high.
Intel reported after Tuesday's stock market close fourth quarter earnings of $2.13 per share, up from $0.98 a year ago. The First Call consensus estimate was $1.84.
In later pre-open activity, Intel traded in a 152-1/2 to 148-3/8 range, traders said.
Elsewhere, Tencor Instrument stock traded up 6-1/2 to 37 before the open after the company announced last night it agreed to be acquired by KLA Instruments Corp in a one-for-one stock swap.
KLA shares traded at 38-9/16 before the open, under the 40-7/8 last Nasdaq trade Tuesday.
Also, Smith Barney raised its recommendation of KLA to buy from neutral, according to a Smith Barney source.
Returning to Intel, the early earnings-driven rise began to erode as the market open approached, the stock trading a slow as 147-1/8, in line with Tuesday's close.

"Everybody and their brother though the earnings were going to be $2.50 (per share), so everybody was long ahead of the number and there is a lot of Intel stock in trading hands that needs to be sold," said a trader of the pullback.
Bay Network Inc shares trade 1-1/8 lower to 22 before the open after reporting last night a fiscal second quarter loss of $0.90 per share verus $0.29 per share profit one year ago.
Among other stock busy before the open, Mastec Inc fell to 66 from 68-7/8 and Zoltek Cos Inc added 1-3/4 to 33.

Clarify tumbled to 38 from 46. In the company's earnings report last night, it said it expects its effective income tax rate to rise to 37 percent in the first quarter of 1997 from 20 percent in the fourth quarter of 1996 because the company has used up an operating loss carryforwards.
Sun Microsystems slipped 1/8 to 28-3/4 and Microsoft traded in line at 85-3/8.
